alert.note: Alert for Glades (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 03 at 5:11AM EDT until October 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Fisheating Creek near Palmdale affecting Glades County. For the Lake Okeechobee/Fisheating Creek...including Ortona Lock, 12 midnight avg lake lvl, Moore Haven Lock, Fisheating Creek near Lakeport at Highway 78, Clewiston Ind. Canal, Palmdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fisheating Creek near Palmdale. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The water begins retreat from inside the main office and store in the campground. The Upstream campground and access roads to the campground are still completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EDT Monday was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 6.7 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 09/09/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fisheating Creek Palmdale 7.0 7.7 Mon 5 am EDT 7.4 7.1 6.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM EDT.
